<div>

# Suspense

</div>

With [Live Resolvers](/docs/guides/relay-resolvers/live-fields/), it\'s possible that the data you are exposing in the graph may not be synchronously available. For example, if you are fetching data from a remote API, it may take some time for the data to be fetched. Relay Resolvers provide a mechanism for handling this loading state.

If a Live Resolver returns the \"suspense sentinel\" value, all consumers of that field will suspend until that field updates with a non-suspense value.

## Suspense Sentinel[â€‹](#suspense-sentinel "Direct link to Suspense Sentinel") 

If a Live Resolver is in a loading state, it may return a special sentinel value to indicate that the data is not yet available.

``` 
import  from 'relay-runtime';

/**
 * @RelayResolver Query.myIp: String
 * @live
 */
export function myIp(): LiveState<string> 
      return state.ip;
    },
    subscribe: (cb) => ,
  };
}
```

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)]note

If a query or fragment will suspend if it reads any resolver field that is in a suspended state, even if it reads that resolver field indirectly via another resolvers `@rootFragment`.

[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)Edit this page](https://github.com/facebook/relay/tree/main/website/versioned_docs/version-v20.1.0/guides/relay-resolvers/suspense.md)
